Name: MTA to allow seniors and people with disabilities to receive fare discounts on express buses during rush hours, between the hours of 6 am to 10 am and between 3 pm and 7 pm on Monday through Friday..
Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to allow seniors and people with disabilities to receive fare discounts on express buses during rush hours, between the hours of 6 am to 10 am and between 3 pm and 7 pm on Monday through Friday.

History.Description: This Resolution was Introduced by Council
This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - January 19, 2023

Text:
By Council Members Holden, Louis, Stevens, Restler, Far�as, Richardson Jordan and Schulman

      Whereas, Currently eligible seniors, those 65 and older, and people with disabilities can ride the local bus and subway for the half-price fare any time of the day; and
      Whereas, However, seniors and people with disabilities are not eligible for the half-price fare on express bus service during rush hours; and
      Whereas, With recent changes to decrease door-to-door service and to increase Access-A-Ride's feeder service to and from fixed routes, it is crucial that seniors and people with disabilities have access to alternative forms of transportation; and
      Whereas, Many seniors and people with disabilities live on a fixed income; and
      Whereas, The express bus base fare has risen from $5.00 in 2010 to $6.75 currently and biannual MTA fare increases are scheduled to continue; and 
      Whereas, The lack of rush hour discounted fares discourages some seniors and people with disabilities from being more active; now, therefore, be it
      Resolved, That the Council of the City of New York calls upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to allow seniors and people with disabilities to receive fare discounts on express buses during rush hours, between the hours of 6 am to 10 am and between 3 pm and 7 pm on Monday through Friday.
Session 12

LS #2362
12/15/2022

Whereas, With recent changes to decrease door-to-door service and to increase Access-A-Ride's feeder service to and from fixed routes, it is crucial that seniors and people with disabilities have access to alternative forms of transportation; and\par
Whereas, Many seniors and people with disabilities live on a fixed income; and\par
Whereas, The express bus base fare has risen from $5.00 in 2010 to $6.75 currently and biannual MTA fare increases are scheduled to continue; and \par
Whereas, The lack of rush hour discounted fares discourages some seniors and people with disabilities from being more active; now, therefore, be it\par
